alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Craven; Pitt (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 23 at 8:40AM EDT until September 23 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport/Morehead City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Beaufort County in eastern North Carolina... Northwestern Craven County in eastern North Carolina... Pitt County in eastern North Carolina... * Until noon EDT. * At 840 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area from Tropical Storm Ophelia. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen since yesterday. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area in a short period of time as the center of the storm moves northward. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Greenville, Washington, Winterville, Ayden, Bethel, Grifton, Stokes, Bell Arthur, Pactolus, Shelmerdine, House, Calico, Black Jack, Fort Barnwell, Bruce, Roundtree, Wilmar, Old Ford, Dowdy Ficklen Stadium and East Carolina University. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
